intro: Homalanthus caloneurus, commonly known as the New Zealand flatworm, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include a slender, branched stem and inconspicuous, greenish-white flowers. It is often found in association with other native flora in its natural habitat.
